article_title: Measuring the Economic Potential of the Internet of Things
article_text:
The latest Nest Cam surveillance video camera from Google’s Nest Labs is on display in San Francisco. Eric Risberg/Associated Press

A recent report estimates the economic impact of Internet of Things applications to fall between $4 trillion to $11 trillion per year by 2025. The range is wide because there remain many unknowns including their level of acceptance by consumers and workers, CIO Journal Columnist Irving Wladawsky-Berger writes. But one thing is sure. With 10 billion interconnected smart devices out there today, the Internet of Things has reached an inflection point.
